perturbation.original_text: ensure that in the event that it enters into an electronic commerce agreement with a third party for the sale of goods on the Co-Branded Site that all agreements with the third parties shall ensure that such third party shall be wholly responsible for all products and transactions that may occur on the Co-Branded Site, that all such transactions shall comply with all applicable Canadian and US laws and regulations, including privacy laws and including compliance with MediaLinx's standards and guidelines, and ensure that such third party
perturbation.changed_text: ensure that in the event that it enters into an electronic commerce agreement with a third party for the sale of goods on the Co-Branded Site that all agreements with the third parties shall ensure that such third party shall be wholly responsible for all products and transactions that may occur on the Co-Branded Site, and ensure that such third party
perturbation.explanation: By removing the requirement for e-commerce transactions to comply with all applicable Canadian and US laws and regulations, including privacy laws, the agreement introduces a legal risk. This omission contradicts consumer protection laws and regulations that mandate specific standards for online transactions, such as data security and fair advertising practices. This introduces legal risk, as the third party is no longer explicitly bound by these laws within the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various consumer protection laws and regulations in both Canada and the United States, including but not limited to the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) in Canada and the Federal Trade Commission Act in the United States.

perturbation.original_text: Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be collected and used in accordance with Canadian federal and provincial laws and U.S. Federal and State laws and both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data.
perturbation.changed_text: Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be collected and used in accordance with MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for customer data collection and use to comply with Canadian federal and provincial laws and U.S. Federal and State laws contradicts established data protection and privacy regulations. This significantly weakens the protection afforded to user data and introduces a legal risk of non-compliance with laws such as PIPEDA in Canada and various state privacy laws in the U.S. such as CCPA and CPRA.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) in Canada, California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), and other relevant privacy laws in the United States.

perturbation.original_text: that no advertisement submitted to MLX hereunder shall make use of any subliminal technique and holds MLX and its affiliated and related companies harmless against any loss or damage arising from the storage and/or use of any and all advertising. HCI warrants that any and all advertising that it submits complies with advertising standards in Canada, including those of MLX and that the use, reproduction, distribution, or transmission of such advertising will not violate any criminal laws, commercial laws or any rights of any third parties, including, but not limited to, such violations as infringement or misappropriation of copyright, patent, trademark, trade secret, music, image, video/full motion video or other proprietary or property right, false advertising, unfair competition, defamation, invasion of privacy or rights of celebrity, property right, false advertising, unfair competition, defamation, invasion of privacy or rights of celebrity, violation of any anti-discrimination law or regulation, or any other right of any person or entity;
perturbation.changed_text: that no advertisement submitted to MLX hereunder shall make use of any subliminal technique and holds MLX and its affiliated and related companies harmless against any loss or damage arising from the storage and/or use of any and all advertising. HCI warrants that any and all advertising that it submits complies with advertising standards in Canada, including those of MLX and that the use, reproduction, distribution, or transmission of such advertising will not violate any rights of any third parties, including, but not limited to, such violations as infringement or misappropriation of copyright, patent, trademark, trade secret, music, image, video/full motion video or other proprietary or property right;
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the phrase 'criminal laws, commercial laws, false advertising, unfair competition, defamation, invasion of privacy or rights of celebrity, violation of any anti-discrimination law or regulation, or any other right of any person or entity,' the modified agreement weakens the warranty provided by HCI regarding its advertising practices. This omission creates a legal loophole and reduces the scope of protection for MLX, potentially exposing them to liability should HCI's advertising practices violate applicable laws and regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Canadian criminal and commercial laws relating to advertising, false advertising laws in both Canada and the U.S., anti-discrimination laws, and privacy laws.
